en.title: ACE â€“ Morning Market Scan
en.lead: Liquidity, trade flows and logistics take center stage: oilseeds react to shifting trade patterns, while grains draw support from a weaker dollar and fund activity despite ample global supply.
en.fx: The U.S. dollar remains soft, driven by expectations of rate cuts in the U.S. and uncertainty around tariffs and fiscal policy. A weaker USD improves the export competitiveness of U.S. grains and soybeans, supporting commodity sentiment.
en.agri: Oilseeds in focus as trade routes shift: China clears Australian rapeseed for processing and expands canola purchases from Australia and Canada, impacting rapeseed balances and vegetable oil price relationships. Grains benefit from a weaker dollar and fund short-covering on CBOT, though gains are capped by abundant global supply. Logistics remain the key short-term constraint in the U.S. soymeal market.

en.lead: A calm start: FX holds direction after yesterdayâ€™s session, while agri markets stay range-bound awaiting fresh export and weather catalysts.
en.fx: EUR/USD steadies after recent moves; the dollar lacks a clear trigger. PLN remains stable â€” moves are contained with sentiment driven mainly by global risk tone.
en.agri: European grains lack direction: MATIF trades in a tight range with selective buying. Oilseeds track vegetable oil sentiment and demand signals.

en.title: ACE â€“ Morning Market Scan
en.lead: Yesterday was cautious: FX watched the dollar, while agri focused on South American supply and export competition.
en.fx: USD traded mixed while EUR kept an edge. PLN stayed stable; markets waited for fresh US signals and data that could lift volatility.
en.agri: Grains: calmer after prior moves, though competitive supply keeps pressure on prices. Oilseeds: sensitive to swings in the vegetable oils complex.
